name: CHICKTEC vision 12
description:
Manual turning, remarkably successful, simple, small incubator. Electronic thermostat. Heat supplied by low wattage light bulb which switches on and off.

Capacity : 12 chicken, 15-20 partridge/quail; 4-6 turkey or goose

name: CHICKTEC covina 20 (semi automatic)
description:
Semi-automatic turning, by means of push rod. Adjustable egg trays, circulated air, electronic thermostat.

Capacity: 15-24 chicken, 60-70 quail eggs

name: Chicktec Vision 40 (automatic turning)
description:
Fan assisted air flow, Automatic turning, superb visibility clear front panel. Digital temperature display, glass thermometer, fan assisted airflow, manual humidity control.

Capacity: 60 chicken; 24 goose; 120 partridge/quail

name: Chicktec Cosmo - Evo LCD Incubator
description:
Fan assisted air flow, automatic turning, adjustable turning grid, high visibility door, LCD electronic PID temperature control c/w c/f conversion, max. temperature alarm, digital humidity reading.

Manual humidity control and externally filled water troughs.

Capacity: 70-75 chicken, Pheasant 96-104, Red leg partridge112-120, Quail/Grey partridge 150-180, Turkey/Duck 62-64, Goose 30-36

name: Chicktec 244 Auto
description:
Digital electronic temperature display and control. Auto turning with tipping trays. Circulated air with adjustable fan speed regulator and adj. air intake. Wet and dry bulb thermometers, interior light, twin viewing portholes. Supplied with one set of 2 egg insert trays of your choice. from chicken, turkey/duck eggs, pheasnt, quail or goose eggs.

Capacity: 144 chicken eggs with chicken trays plus 100 in hatching tray.

name: Chicktec mini chick brooder
description: Small self contained brooder for up to approx 10 chicks or 25 quail. Integral handle allows whole brooder, complete with chicks to be lifted off droppings tray for easy cleaning. Overhead heat lamp. Mini drinker and feeder included.

name: Chicktec electric poultry brooder
description:
Self contained unit with thermostatically controlled overhead heater, integral feed troughs and water supply. Sliding front panels and internal lighting. Removable droppings tray. 

Size: 100 X 55 X 35 cm high, plus legs.

Capacity: 60-70 hen, 70-80 pheasant, 180-200 quail

name: Chicktec Superflash candling lamp
description: Candling lamp - hand held, push button mains operated

name: Herban (250 ml)
description:
Herban poultry tonic is a concentrated blend of herbal and essential oils (including oregano oil)

Effective organic alternative to Emtryl or other antibiotics.

Suitable for all poultry and game birds to combat most diseases including Avian Flu, Blackhead, coccidiosis, mycoplasma, infectious bronchitis, Salmonela, e-coli etc.

Is also ideal as a general tonic and can be used as a preventative in times of stress. Can be added to feed or water.

1.5 - 3 ml per 10 litres of water. 

250 ml bottle

name: Respite (1 litre)
description:
Respite is a tried and trusted formula for the treatment of coughs, colds and respitory ailments in poultry and other animals.

Use 45 ml per 6 lites of drinking water over 3 days

name: Verm-X Liquid - 1 ltr
description:
Verm-X Internal Parasite Control 1 litre

For control of worms and internal parasites. Verm-X for Poultry has the advantage of having no egg or eating bird withdrawal period.

Add 1.5ml per bird to their drinking water for 3 consecutive days every 4 weeks.

name: Verm-X Liquid - 500ml
description:
Verm-X Internal Parasite Control 500ml 

For control of worms and internal parasites. 

Verm-X for Poultry has the advantage of having no egg or eating bird withdrawal period.

Add 1.5ml per bird to their drinking water for 3 consecutive days every 4 weeks.

name: Verm-X liquid- 250ml
description:
Verm-X Internal Parasite Control 250ml

For control of worms and internal parasites. 

Verm-X for Poultry has the advantage of having no egg or eating bird withdrawal period. Add 1.5ml per bird to their drinking water for 3 consecutive days every 4 weeks.

name: Verm-X - pellets 1.5 kg
description:
Verm-X Pellets for Poultry 1.5kg Tub 

Internal parasite control for poultry, being a 100% natural herbal formula there is no egg withdrawal period

Verm-X is easy to use by adding to your bird’s feed for 3 consecutive days per month. 

A further advantage of Verm-X over chemical based products is that if you are growing your birds for your dinner table there is no withdrawal period after using Verm-X prior to eating.

Add 2.5g per bird to feed for 3 consecutive days - repeat every 4 weeks.

name: Verm-X Pellets - 750g
description:
Verm-X Pellets for Poultry 750g 

Internal parasite control for poultry, being a 100% natural herbal formula there is no egg withdrawal period 

Verm-X is easy to use by adding to your bird’s feed for 3 consecutive days per month. 

A further advantage of Verm-X over chemical based products is that if you are growing your birds for your dinner table there is no withdrawal period after using Verm-X prior to eating.

Add 2.5g per bird to feed for 3 consecutive days - repeat every 4 weeks.

name: Verm-X pellets - 250g sachet
description:
Verm-X Pellets for Poultry 250g Sachet

Internal parasite control for poultry, being a 100% natural herbal formula there is no egg withdrawal period 

Verm-X is easy to use by adding to your bird’s feed for 3 consecutive days per month.

A further advantage of Verm-X over chemical based products is that if you are growing your birds for your dinner table there is no withdrawal period after using Verm-X prior to eating.

Add 2.5g per bird to feed for 3 consecutive days - repeat every 4 weeks.

name: Verm-x Keep-Well 750g
description:
Keep-Well is the new 100% natural tonic from the makers of Verm-x. It is a non-GM pelleted formulation for improving and maintaining the general health in all poultry and fowl.

Feed 2.5g per bird per day as required (scoop included). Average period of use is 14-28 days to improve health or can be used all year round as a general tonic.

name: Verm-x Keep-Well 250g
description:
Keep-Well is the new 100% natural tonic from the makers of Verm-x. It is a non-GM pelleted formulation for improving and maintaining general health in poultry and fowl.

Feed 2.5g per bird per day as required (scoop included). Average period of use is 14-28 days to improve health or can be used all year round as a general tonic.

name: Poultry Spice (450g)
description:
Poultry spice is a mineral supplement to give poultry. It will improve all round condition and performance. The aromatic blend of highly palatable spices will encourage the birds to feed which will help keep them strong and healthy. The high mineral content will promote good egg shell quality.

Invaluable to help birds get over the moult. Will help keep birds in good condition.

Easy to use - just add to feed.

450g container

name: Battle Poultry Drink (500ml)
description:
Poultry drink contains a selection of 5 minerals in a high energy sugar syrup base to support all round condition and health in poultry.

Simply add to drinking water or daily ration. Ideal for birds looking a bit off colour. Contains iron, phosphorus, potassium, maganese and copper.

Add 10 ml of poultry drink to each 4.5 litres of drinking water.

500 ml container

name: Harkers Coxoid - 112ml
description:
Coxoid is a water soluble treatment for coccidiosis (going light). 

Coxoid is added to the drinking water for 7 days and during treatment birds should not have access to unmedicated water. 

A favourable reaction may be expected within 2 days. 112ml (sufficient for 30 birds) and 500ml (sufficient for 130 birds).

name: Harkers Coxoid -500ml
description:
Treatment and prevention of Coccidiosis, often known as 'Going Light'. 

Coxoid is added to the drinking water for 7 days and during treatment birds should not have access to unmedicated water. 

A favourable reaction may be expected within 2 days. 

500ml (sufficient for 130 birds).

Contains Amprolium Hydrochloride 3.84% w/v

name: Barrier scaly leg treatment
description: A ready to use insect repellent spray, for use against scaly leg mite on poultry and other birds. Will effectively rid the bird of mite whilst soothing and calming the irritation. Will not taint eggs. Suitable for use in organic systems. Fully HSE Approved and Licensed (Birds & Poultry)

name: Featherite (anti-pecking spray) 200ml
description:
Featherite helps break the habit of feather pecking and allows new feathers to grow without disturbance.

Non-toxic and non-staining

200ml

name: Barrier V1 (5 ltre) - MAFF approved virucidal disinfectant
description:
The first ever non-toxic, non-irritant, Virucidal Disinfectant which is made using only natural plant derived non-toxic ingredients and FEMA registered. 

Suitable for use in Organic Farming Systems: Barrier V1 is made using only pure and natural concentrated plant derivatives, which are entirely non-toxic and non-irritant. 

Barrier V1 is a MAFF approved virucidal disinfectant for use against Diseases of Poultry at 1:50 parts water.

Barrier V1 is not affected by organic matter. It has a pleasant smell and when used in rearing housing and when the heat is up, it vapourises and continues to protect against bacteria.

Also available in 1 ltre packs

name: Barrier V1 (1 ltre) - MAFF approved virucidal disinfectant
description:
The first ever non-toxic, non-irritant, Virucidal Disinfectant which is made using only natural plant derived non-toxic ingredients and FEMA registered. 

Suitable for use in Organic Farming Systems: Barrier V1 is made using only pure and natural concentrated plant derivatives, which are entirely non-toxic and non-irritant. 

Barrier V1 is a MAFF approved virucidal disinfectant for use against Diseases of Poultry at 1:50 parts water.

Barrier V1 is not affected by organic matter. It has a pleasant smell and when used in rearing housing and when the heat is up, it vapourises and continues to protect against bacteria.

Also available in 5 ltre packs

name: Chicktec Hatchery Sanitiser 1 kg (egg wash)
description:
Safe, non-corrosive, non-toxic, non-staining, non-irritant sanitiser. Food safe & biodegradable. Effective against viruses, bacteria & fungi. For cleaning and disinfection of all surfaces as well as an egg wash

1 kg

name: Smite - 1 litre
description:
Effective for elimination of RED MITE and other parasites

Effective against mite eggs

Non-toxic and does not conain pesticides

Pleasant odur and easy to use dosing pump

Economical - only 3-6% dilution required (1 lt makes up to 34 litres of treatment) 

Effective degreasant and cleaner - ideal for removing organic matter

Suitable for all animal housing

One product does it all - Smite the mite !

Clean and disinfect - save time and money !

name: Red Mite Concentrate - (5 ltre)
description:
Red Mite Concentrate is an effective repellent combinations to be applied to poultry as a proactive ‘0n bird’ deterrent to infestation or to rectify an existing problem. 

The formulation uses only 100% natural ingredients. Its active ingredient is a synergised tropical plant extract mixed with a blend of herbal and essential oils, all of which are proven effective against all types of mite and lice. 

A liquid concentrate - for knapsack application at 1:50 dilution. Fully HSE Approved - Licence No. 8304: Use biocides safely. 

Suitable for use in organic farming systems, as it falls into the exempt category of products which use only plant oils as active ingredients.

Also available in 500ml pack and as a powder

name: Red Mite Concentrate - 500ml
description:
Red Mite Concentrate is an effective repellent combinations to be applied to poultry as a proactive ‘0n bird’ deterrent to infestation or to rectify an existing problem. 

The formulation uses only 100% natural ingredients. Its active ingredient is a synergised tropical plant extract mixed with a blend of herbal and essential oils, all of which are proven effective against all types of mite and lice. 

A liquid concentrate - for knapsack application at 1:50 dilution. Fully HSE Approved - Licence No. 8304: Use biocides safely. 

Suitable for use in organic farming systems, as it falls into the exempt category of products which use only plant oils as active ingredients.

Also available in 5 ltre pack and as a powder

name: Red Mite Powder - 5kg
description:
Red Mite Powder is an effective repellent combinations to be applied to poultry as a proactive ‘0n bird’ deterrent to infestation or to rectify an existing problem. 

The formulation uses only 100% natural ingredients. Its active ingredient is a synergised tropical plant extract mixed with a blend of herbal and essential oils, all of which are proven effective against all types of mite and lice. 

A powder - to dust on for a long lasting effect.  Fully HSE Approved - Licence No. 8304: Use biocides safely. 

Suitable for use in organic farming systems, as it falls into the exempt category of products which use only plant oils as active ingredients.

Also available in 5 kg pack and as a concentrate

name: Red Mite Powder - 500g
description:
Red Mite Powder is an effective repellent combinations to be applied to poultry as a proactive ‘0n bird’ deterrent to infestation or to rectify an existing problem. 

The formulation uses only 100% natural ingredients. Its active ingredient is a synergised tropical plant extract mixed with a blend of herbal and essential oils, all of which are proven effective against all types of mite and lice. 

A powder - to dust on for a long lasting effect.  Fully HSE Approved - Licence No. 8304: Use biocides safely. 

Suitable for use in organic farming systems, as it falls into the exempt category of products which use only plant oils as active ingredients.

Also available in 5 kg pack and as a concentrate

name: Louse Powder - 5kg
description:
Our unique formulation of Louse Powder contains a safe-carrier that does not cause carcinogenic effects. 

Designed to be applied directly to all animals it is suitable for use in organic farming systems, as it falls into the exempt category of products which use only plant oils as active ingredients

It successfully rids poultry of both sucking and biting Lice; which are normally dealt with separately, and will help to prevent reduced growth rates, which can result from lice infestation. 

Full HSE Approval - Licence No 8310. In accordance with the Biocidal Products Directive, Suitable for use in Organic Systems: and is specifically designed to be applied directly to animals to be used as a protection against or where there is existing infestation. 

It works at repelling the lice over a six week period.

Also avaialble in 500g packs

name: Louse Powder - 500g
description:
A unique formulation of Louse Powder contains a safe-carrier that does not cause carcinogenic effects. 

Designed to be applied directly to all animals it is suitable for use in organic farming systems, as it falls into the exempt category of products which use only plant oils as active ingredients

It successfully rids poultry of both sucking and biting Lice; which are normally dealt with separately, and will help to prevent reduced growth rates, which can result from lice infestation. 

Full HSE Approval - Licence No 8310. In accordance with the Biocidal Products Directive, Suitable for use in Organic Systems: and is specifically designed to be applied directly to animals to be used as a protection against or where there is existing infestation. 

It works at repelling the lice over a six week period.

Also avaialble in 5kg tubs

name: False/dummy Egg -Brown (rubber)
description: False/dummy egg - brown, rubber

name: Super Drinker - 4 ltr
description:
Unique patented design, the legs can be unfolded twice to adjust the height of the drinker to the age and type of birds. 

Fully unfolded, the legs will raise the drinkers by 7.5cm. Anti–perch pointed dome.

Manufactured from heavy duty high density ultraviolet resistant plastic. Features easy carry handles and anti–perch domes. 

26cm pan 90 chicks

name: Red & white chick drinker (1 litre)
description: 1 litre red and white drinker, ideal for chicks.

name: Super Feeder Hopper - 5 kg
description: "no perch" top sold separately (£2.25) - see products listing

name: Super Feeder Hopper - 3 kg
description: "no perch" top sold separately (£2.25) - see products listing

name: Super Feeder "no perch" Top
description: "no perch" top sold separately (£2.25) - see products listing

name: Feeder (3kg) Ideal for chick crumbs
description: Ideal feeder for chick crumbs

name: Feeder (1 kg) Ideal for chick crumbs
description: Ideal feeder for chick crumbs

name: Infra Red Lamp Holder
description:
Conforms to the latest IPX4 Standards.

Supplied with fixing hooks, 2m of adjustable chain, 5m of electrical cable and moulded plug.

WARNING - only use bulbs or filters, do not use heating elements or dull emitters. The vertical distance between the heater and floor must exceed 1 metre. This can be adjusted with the snaphook and chain.

name: Infra Red Lamp (Ruby red) Bulb 250W
description: code 04540

name: Nail Clippers
description: Nail clippers for grooming and preparing your poultry for Show

name: 16mm Leg Ring Pack - Large Fowl (pack of 50)
Starting with Chickens - a Beginners Guide
description:
Our best-selling title and currently the UK's best-selling book on chickens. 

Comprehensive help for all those who wish to keep chickens on a small scale. 

It covers everything from choosing a house to selecting, buying and caring for hens. Over 90 breeds are illustrated, many in colour. Feeding, breeding, eggs and seasonal care are discussed, as well as dealing with problems should they occur.

Written in a clear and concise way - an ideal introduction.

name: Starting with Bantams - by David Scrivener
description:
This excellent book is written by an experienced bantam and large fowl poultry breeder and show judge.

Covering soft feather bantams, hard-feather bantams, true bantams and rare breed bantams, it is an ideal introduction to a popular subject.

name: Starting with Ducks - by Katie Thear
description:
This is the book on domestic and ornamental breeds for the beginner. 

Full of practical tips, it provides information on how to set up a small unit, managing ponds and streams. 

Covers all aspects of keeping, breeding and rearing ducks.

name: Starting with Turkeys - by Katie Thear
description:
A well illustrated and readable book covering all aspects of keeping, breeding, raising and showing turkeys on a small scale 

It describes the traditional breeds and how to cater for the free-range and organic Christmas markets. - Includes full colour photographs.

name: Turkeys at Home by Michael Roberts
description:
A book about small scale turkey production with chapters on 

* the history of turkeys, 
* characteristics and behavior, 
*breeds and colour variations, 
*nutrition, breeding, 
*housing, hatching and rearing, 
*preparation for the table, 
*marketing and regulations, 
*exhibiting and diseases. 

Many illustrations and photographs in colour and black and white. Paperback - 64 pages

name: Keeping Quail - Fourth Edition by Katie Thear
description:
Published 21st March 2005, this new edition contains over 40 colour photographs as well as mono photographs and line drawings.

It provides an up-to-date and practical coverage of the selection, housing, feeding, breeding and breed development of Coturnix and aviary breeds of quail.

Invaluable to breeders of quail, both large and small, 96 page full of information.

name: Incubation: A Guide to Hatching and Rearing
description:
Published in 2003 this book covers the use of small to medium sized incubators and brooders, as well as larger systems for more exotic species. 

Species covered: chickens, ducks, geese, turkeys, guinea fowl, quail, pheasants, partridges, peafowl, ostriches, emus, rheas and parrots. 

Relevant to poultry keepers, waterfowl and game breeders, and anyone with an interest in domestic and exotic species of birds.

name: Starting with Geese - By Katie Thear
description:
Available now, a new guide to keeping domestic breeds and ornamental geese on a small or commercial scale. 

Housing, pasture and water access, feeding, care and management, breeding, selling and showing.

All the domestic breeds and a selection of ornamentals in full colour

name: Chickens at Home by Michael Roberts
description:
A practical guide to keeping and rearing laying hens and bantams. 

Well reviewed book on different methods of keeping chickens in the garden or smallholding with plenty of practical advice on how to care for them. One of the easiest books to follow on keeping Chickens or Bantams in your garden, orchard or smallholding. 

Every step explained with daily and weekend routines, chapters on expenses, housing, hatching, rearing, diseases and ailments, together with many illustrations and photographs. 

Paperback - 54 pages

name: Bantams in Colour by Michael Roberts
description:
This was The Golden Cockerill Series first colour photographic book, originally printed in 1984, showing 40 breeds of bantam and miniature fowl. 

This book is a must for identifying different breeds or for choosing a breed to keep. There are over 121 photographs and illustrations. 

Paperback - 49 pages

name: Poultry House Construction by Michael Roberts
description:
This is a D.I.Y. guide to building houses and allied equipment such as show boxes, free range feeder, trap nest boxes. 

There are 13 projects, all with photographs of the finished article and diagrams with measurements of all the panels or sections; very easy to follow and to make. 

Projects include: Bantam House, 8ft Run, 6 or 8ft Ark, Eight or Ten Hen Coop and Poultry Palace. Other chapters include Housing Criteria, Tools Required and Timber Treatment. 

Paperback - 92 pages

name: Modern Free Range by Michael Roberts
description:
A practical guide for the small farmer on free range egg production and sales. 

There are chapters on integration with other farming interests, costs of 100 bird units, marketing and regulations, types of housing, fencing, feeding, lighting, general management, diseases and ailments. 

Paperback - 54 pages

name: Ducks and Geese at Home by Michael Roberts
description:
If you are wanting to keep a few ducks or geese, this is the book for you. 

There are chapters on the different breeds, marketing ducks and geese, breeding, different methods of keeping ducks and geese, hatching and rearing, general management, exhibition and diseases and ailments. 

Paperback - 56 pages

name: Incubation at Home by Michael Roberts
description:
This is a detailed book about using small incubators and most of the problems encountered using them. 

There are chapters on different types of incubators, preparation for incubation such as cleaning and sterilisation, thermometers, humidity, collection and storage of eggs, candling, hatching, sexing and rearing plus a chapter on "where did I go wrong?" 

Packed full of information, mainly first hand too! Lots of illustrations and photographs. 

Paperback - 54 pages

name: Domestic Ducks & Geese in Colour by Michael Roberts
description:
This is a colour guide to most breeds of domestic ducks and geese, also showing most colour variations in each breed, including call ducks and Indian runners. Over 122 photographs. 

Paperback - 54 pages

name: British Large Fowl by Michael Roberts
description:
This book documents the 22 breeds that have been developed in Britain together with their history and most of their colour variations. 92 colour photographs in all. 

Paperback - 68 pages

name: Poultry & Waterfowl Problems by Michael Roberts
description:
This book covers most of the diseases and ailments encountered in keeping poultry, turkeys and waterfowl. 

It is written in plain English in an easy to follow format describing signs, causes, prevention, treatment and mortality. It also includes many of the drugs used in the treatment of diseases. 

There is a list of avian vets in Britain at the back of this book and a translation of veterinary terms into plain English. There are many illustrations and photographs. 

Paperback - 94 pages

Paperback - 94 pages

name: Modern Vermin Control by Michael Roberts
description:
If you have problems with rats, mice, moles, foxes, magpies etc. this book will tell you how to control them. there are chapters on trapping, poisoning and identifying your pest, and plenty of illustrations and photographs. 

Paperback - 56 pages
